channel.title: Error when I runserver?
channel.description: Whenever I click the runserver.bat, it comes up with an error - "Error: Unable to start up listener on 43594 - port already in use?" I have tried restarting my router, and my computer and nothing works. I don't have anything that is runescape related at all, and this is still giving me this error. Could it be something wrong with my environment variables, or maybe a file in the source? Any help is appreciated. -Alex

item.title: Error when I runserver?
item.dc:creator: @eyeheartlax eyeheartlax
item.description:
@eyeheartlax wrote:

Disaster, I don’t have anything torrent related running… So I’m not sure what I could close. And tillly, when I change the ports on my default gateway in my browser, what file do I look in on my source/client to change the port?

Also, thanks everyone for helping.

EDIT: Okay, I think I may have fixed this. If someone could do me a HUGE favor and try to log into the server, sativascape.no-ip.org and let me know what happens that would be great! Thank you!

Read full topic

item.title: Error when I runserver?
item.dc:creator: @xxxtilllyxxx xxxtilllyxxx
item.description:
@xxxtilllyxxx wrote:

Edit the ports to 5555 if 43594 is already in use, 5555 is the secondary port for rsps.

Read full topic

item.title: Error when I runserver?
item.dc:creator: @disasterscape disasterscape
item.description:
@disasterscape wrote:

[quote=“macca4g, post:1, topic:398959”]It sounds like this is a leeched server and the person who u leeched it off if already running the server… hence why the port is already being used…

thefore if this is the case you wont be able to connect

OR !!!

go into your router setting and see what the port is being used for and if it is being used on somthing not useful just redo it and make it for your rsps =-)[/quote]

made me lol
urm i had this problem and it was because i had torrent open and it was listening on that port so idk try that?

Read full topic

item.title: Error when I runserver?
item.dc:creator: @eyeheartlax eyeheartlax
item.description:
@eyeheartlax wrote:

The server is a blank dodian server that I downloaded to see if I could host my own server, before I got into learning about the basics of coding etc. So I guess what you’re saying could be whats wrong with it. But, I portforwarded, edited my environment variables, opened up the port in my firewall and downloaded no-ip. If this were the reason I couldn’t be running it, then wouldn’t anyone who leeched a server, not be able to run it?..

And, tinyscape, I have restarted my computer many times. And no I do not have bittorrent.

Read full topic

item.title: Error when I runserver?
item.dc:creator: @tinyscape TinyScape
item.description:
@tinyscape wrote:

[quote=“macca4g, post:1, topic:398959”]It sounds like this is a leeched server and the person who u leeched it off if already running the server… hence why the port is already being used…

thefore if this is the case you wont be able to connect[/quote]LOL!

Restart your computer to kill off the process which is using port 43594.
If this still doesn’t work, Check Bittorrent (If you have it) to see if it’s using that port.

Read full topic

item.title: Error when I runserver?
item.dc:creator: @eyeheartlax eyeheartlax
item.description:
@eyeheartlax wrote:

Thanks Meeper, but that didn’t work either. It just made the text green. If anyone else knows what could be causing this, please let me know.

Read full topic

item.title: Error when I runserver?
item.dc:creator: @Meeper98 Meeper98
item.description:
@Meeper98 wrote:

open task manager and check for “java.exe” if any programs are running under that name close it, and try to run your server, other then that all i can say is make sure you dont have another run program open which it appears not to be. Also make sure your run is set to this

@echo off color 0a title YOURNAMEHERE java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

Depending on the source that should work for delta, allstar, ect; If your using dspk theres a memoryleak.bat you should try; Hope i helped as i really cant expand much on this as i haven’t seen this problem before.

Read full topic

item.title: Error when I runserver?
item.dc:creator: @eyeheartlax eyeheartlax
item.description:
@eyeheartlax wrote:

Whenever I click the runserver.bat, it comes up with an error -
“Error: Unable to start up listener on 43594 - port already in use?”
I have tried restarting my router, and my computer and nothing works. I don’t have anything that is runescape related at all, and this is still giving me this error. Could it be something wrong with my environment variables, or maybe a file in the source? Any help is appreciated.
-Alex
